page.title: 07ST JAMES CHURCH TEBAY
page.content: The Church of Tebay is made out of stone from Shap Quarry.It has a cylindrical tower with spire. surrounding the Church is a graveyard with about 100 graves in.The inside of the Church is decorated with red and white brickwork because the church was bulit at the same time as the Railway Station in the village and red and white are the colours of the London, Midland and Scottish Railway company which existed before British Railways came into being (1948). The East window is Stained glass and it tells the story of The Nativity and the Resurrection. The Pulpit and the Font are made of polished limestone marble from Shap Quarry. The present vicar of Tebay,Rev.M.Comber,is responsible for the parishes of Orton & Ravenstonedale.
